docs.text: Home This site will collate random useful information, and act as a collaborative platform for projects (like the trading bot). It's more structured than pinning things in Telegram chats, or Google Docs which you forget the links to. Main projects appear as main pages in the sidebar, while other minor and one-off things appear under Posts. Github Repo

docs.text: Lazarus Camping 9-10 Apr 2022 Overall notes: Ferry tickets are negotiable. Umbrella, hats, fans and sunscreen are essential equipments to get along with the hot sun. Campsite A was very noisy at night. However, it is also the only campsite that doesn't have light shining in in the morning. Multiple mosquito coils are required to ensure you don't get bitten. But you will still get bitten on the go. Actual water consumption for 2 people was about 4.5L, including washing. There is a functional shower at St John's Island toilet (25 minutes walk from Lazarus Island Beach) - perhaps bringing a bicycle would be more convenient. There are many flies and ants during cooking - may be good to do cooking at the pavilions available on the island. Butane gas lasts for very long, long enough to do a proper hotpot. Cooking hotpot in a small pot is not advisable due to the long cooking time. 1.2kg of meat is somewhat overkill for 4 people - perhaps 800g would have been just nice.
docs.title: 9-10 Apr 2022 Lazarus Camping

Actual water consumption for 2 people was about 4.5L, including washing. There is a functional shower at St John's Island toilet (25 minutes walk from Lazarus Island Beach) - perhaps bringing a bicycle would be more convenient. There are many flies and ants during cooking - may be good to do cooking at the pavilions available on the island. Butane gas lasts for very long, long enough to do a proper hotpot. Cooking hotpot in a small pot is not advisable due to the long cooking time. 1.2kg of meat is somewhat overkill for 4 people - perhaps 800g would have been just nice.

docs.text: France (Nice) Hiking 7-10 May 2022 Itinerary 7 May, Saturday 4.20pm: Nicholas reaches NCE T1 Walk to Carrefour / Supermarche Casino to buy: Dinner Hiking snacks Water Camping fuel Buy bus card if necessary 6.30pm: Bus 90 from Grand Arenas to La Colmiane , 1hr 35min ( Google Maps Directions ) Overnight in hotel 8 May, Sunday Free breakfast at hotel Checkout, fill water Hiking route: Col de Veillos, Col du Barn, Mont Pépoiri and Baus de la Frema (16.9km loop, .gpx file ) Optionally detour to Lacs des Millefonts ( .gpx file ) Map of routes (Chanel) Other options (AllTrails) Pitch campsite by sunset (~8pm) Overnight in tent, with Milky Way/stargazing 9 May, Monday If not camping, La Colmiane, Col de Varaire, Caire Gros ( .gpx file ) (12.4km loop) is another option in the south. Begin trek back to hotel Check-in, enjoy nice shower 7.30pm: EUR27 Dinner with local cheese Overnight in hotel 10 May, Tuesday 10.36am: Bus 90 from Saint-Dalmas to Grand Arenas , 1hr 44min ( Google Maps Directions ) 6.40pm: Flight back to Singapore (LH1065 at NCE T1) Accomodation 7-10May Chambres d'hôtes Le Grand Chalet EUR262.20 (128/night) Free cancellation until 29Apr Complimentary breakfast 0730-0930 EUR27 Aperitif & dinner at 1930 for (reservation must be made 72hrs in advance) Other properties Misc Chanel Items to get/pack Trekking shoes (after looking at the temperature, the brown one is fine) Backpack: 30L and above, with waist strap (I can lend you) Sleeping bag (I will lend you one) Baselayer, preferably wool Waterproof outer layer Fleece/mid layer jacket Weather, Celestial Bodies Sunrise: 0610-0620, Sunset: 2035-2045 (>14hrs of daylight) Temperature: 14°C day, 5°C night Comprehensive weather information Milky Way visibility: 8 May: 0020-0414 (moonset 0249 40%) 9 May: 0016-0412 (moonset 0319 49%) 10 May: 0012-0410 (moonset 0345 61%) Flight Details Nicholas 7 May: BA0334 LHR, T5 (1310hrs) to NCE, T1 (1620hrs) 10 May: LH1065 NCE to FRA (1840hrs), FRA to SIN (LH778) Chanel 10 May: LH1065 NCE to FRA (1840hrs), FRA to SIN (LH778) Bus Schedules Bus 90 schedule, in French Bus 90 schedule, English Total Cost Accommodation Food
